19class GcSafeCode;

21namespace wasm {
22class WasmCode;

24
25class SafepointEntry : public SafepointEntryBase {
26 public:
27 SafepointEntry() = default;
28
29 SafepointEntry(int pc, int deopt_index, uint32_t tagged_register_indexes,
30 base::Vector<uint8_t> tagged_slots, int trampoline_pc)
31 : SafepointEntryBase(pc, deopt_index, trampoline_pc),
32 tagged_register_indexes_(tagged_register_indexes),
33 tagged_slots_(tagged_slots) {
34 DCHECK(is_initialized());
35 }
36
37 bool operator==(const SafepointEntry& other) const {
38 return this->SafepointEntryBase::operator==(other) &&
39 tagged_register_indexes_ == other.tagged_register_indexes_ &&
40 tagged_slots_ == other.tagged_slots_;
41 }
42
43 uint32_t tagged_register_indexes() const {
44 DCHECK(is_initialized());
45 return tagged_register_indexes_;
46 }
47
48 base::Vector<const uint8_t> tagged_slots() const {
49 DCHECK(is_initialized());
50 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(tagged_slots_.data());
51 return tagged_slots_;
52 }
53
54 private:
55 uint32_t tagged_register_indexes_ = 0;
56 base::Vector<uint8_t> tagged_slots_;
57};
58
59// A wrapper class for accessing the safepoint table embedded into the
60// InstructionStream object.
61class SafepointTable {
62 public:
63 // The isolate and pc arguments are used for figuring out whether pc
64 // belongs to the embedded or un-embedded code blob.
65 explicit SafepointTable(Isolate* isolate, Address pc,
66 Tagged<InstructionStream> code);
67 explicit SafepointTable(Isolate* isolate, Address pc, Tagged<Code> code);
68#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
69 explicit SafepointTable(const wasm::WasmCode* code);
70#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
71
72 SafepointTable(const SafepointTable&) = delete;
73 SafepointTable& operator=(const SafepointTable&) = delete;
74
75 int length() const { return length_; }
76
77 int byte_size() const {
78 return kHeaderSize + length_ * (entry_size() + tagged_slots_bytes());
79 }
80
81 int find_return_pc(int pc_offset);
82
83 SafepointEntry GetEntry(int index) const {
84 DCHECK_GT(length_, index);
85 Address entry_ptr =
86 safepoint_table_address_ + kHeaderSize + index * entry_size();
87
88 int pc = read_bytes(&entry_ptr, pc_size());
89 int deopt_index = SafepointEntry::kNoDeoptIndex;
90 int trampoline_pc = SafepointEntry::kNoTrampolinePC;
91 if (has_deopt_data()) {
92 static_assert(SafepointEntry::kNoDeoptIndex == -1);
93 static_assert(SafepointEntry::kNoTrampolinePC == -1);
94 // `-1` to restore the original value, see also
95 // SafepointTableBuilder::Emit.
96 deopt_index = read_bytes(&entry_ptr, deopt_index_size()) - 1;
97 trampoline_pc = read_bytes(&entry_ptr, pc_size()) - 1;
98 DCHECK(deopt_index >= 0 || deopt_index == SafepointEntry::kNoDeoptIndex);
99 DCHECK(trampoline_pc >= 0 ||
100 trampoline_pc == SafepointEntry::kNoTrampolinePC);
101 }
102 int tagged_register_indexes =
103 read_bytes(&entry_ptr, register_indexes_size());
104
105 // Entry bits start after the the vector of entries (thus the pc offset of
106 // the non-existing entry after the last one).
107 uint8_t* tagged_slots_start = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(
108 safepoint_table_address_ + kHeaderSize + length_ * entry_size());
109 base::Vector<uint8_t> tagged_slots(
110 tagged_slots_start + index * tagged_slots_bytes(),
111 tagged_slots_bytes());
112
113 return SafepointEntry(pc, deopt_index, tagged_register_indexes,
114 tagged_slots, trampoline_pc);
115 }
116
117 // Returns the entry for the given pc.
118 SafepointEntry FindEntry(Address pc) const;
119 static SafepointEntry FindEntry(Isolate* isolate, Tagged<GcSafeCode> code,
120 Address pc);
121 // Tries to find the entry for the given pc. If the entry does not exist, it
122 // returns an uninitialized entry.
123 SafepointEntry TryFindEntry(Address pc) const;
124
125 void Print(std::ostream&) const;
126
127 private:
128 SafepointTable(Isolate* isolate, Address pc, Tagged<GcSafeCode> code);
129
130 // Layout information.
131 static constexpr int kLengthOffset = 0;
132 static constexpr int kEntryConfigurationOffset = kLengthOffset + kIntSize;
133 static constexpr int kHeaderSize = kEntryConfigurationOffset + kUInt32Size;
134
135 using HasDeoptDataField = base::BitField<bool, 0, 1>;
136 using RegisterIndexesSizeField = HasDeoptDataField::Next<int, 3>;
137 using PcSizeField = RegisterIndexesSizeField::Next<int, 3>;
138 using DeoptIndexSizeField = PcSizeField::Next<int, 3>;
139 // In 22 bits, we can encode up to 4M bytes, corresponding to 32M frame slots,
140 // which is 128MB on 32-bit and 256MB on 64-bit systems. The stack size is
141 // limited to a bit below 1MB anyway (see v8_flags.stack_size).
142 using TaggedSlotsBytesField = DeoptIndexSizeField::Next<int, 22>;
143
144 SafepointTable(Address instruction_start, Address safepoint_table_address);
145
146 int entry_size() const {
147 int deopt_data_size = has_deopt_data() ? pc_size() + deopt_index_size() : 0;
148 return pc_size() + deopt_data_size + register_indexes_size();
149 }
150
151 int tagged_slots_bytes() const {
152 return TaggedSlotsBytesField::decode(entry_configuration_);
153 }
154 bool has_deopt_data() const {
155 return HasDeoptDataField::decode(entry_configuration_);
156 }
157 int pc_size() const { return PcSizeField::decode(entry_configuration_); }
158 int deopt_index_size() const {
159 return DeoptIndexSizeField::decode(entry_configuration_);
160 }
161 int register_indexes_size() const {
162 return RegisterIndexesSizeField::decode(entry_configuration_);
163 }
164
165 static int read_bytes(Address* ptr, int bytes) {
166 uint32_t result = 0;
167 for (int b = 0; b < bytes; ++b, ++*ptr) {
168 result |= uint32_t{*reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(*ptr)} << (8 * b);
169 }
170 return static_cast<int>(result);
171 }
172
173 DISALLOW_GARBAGE_COLLECTION(no_gc_)
174
175 const Address instruction_start_;
176
177 // Safepoint table layout.
178 const Address safepoint_table_address_;
179 const int length_;
180 const uint32_t entry_configuration_;
181
182 friend class SafepointTableBuilder;
183 friend class SafepointEntry;
184};
185
186class SafepointTableBuilder : public SafepointTableBuilderBase {
187 private:
188 struct EntryBuilder {
189 int pc;
190 int deopt_index = SafepointEntry::kNoDeoptIndex;
191 int trampoline = SafepointEntry::kNoTrampolinePC;
192 GrowableBitVector* stack_indexes;
193 uint32_t register_indexes = 0;
194 EntryBuilder(Zone* zone, int pc)
195 : pc(pc), stack_indexes(zone->New<GrowableBitVector>()) {}
196 };
197
198 public:
199 explicit SafepointTableBuilder(Zone* zone) : entries_(zone), zone_(zone) {}
200
201 SafepointTableBuilder(const SafepointTableBuilder&) = delete;
202 SafepointTableBuilder& operator=(const SafepointTableBuilder&) = delete;
203
204 class Safepoint {
205 public:
206 void DefineTaggedStackSlot(int index) {
207 // Note it is only valid to specify stack slots here that are *not* in
208 // the fixed part of the frame (e.g. argc, target, context, stored rbp,
209 // return address). Frame iteration handles the fixed part of the frame
210 // with custom code, see Turbofan::Iterate.
211 entry_->stack_indexes->Add(index, table_->zone_);
212 table_->UpdateMinMaxStackIndex(index);
213 }
214
215 void DefineTaggedRegister(int reg_code) {
216 DCHECK_LT(reg_code,
217 kBitsPerByte * sizeof(EntryBuilder::register_indexes));
218 entry_->register_indexes |= 1u << reg_code;
219 }
220
221 private:
222 friend class SafepointTableBuilder;
223 Safepoint(EntryBuilder* entry, SafepointTableBuilder* table)
224 : entry_(entry), table_(table) {}
225 EntryBuilder* const entry_;
226 SafepointTableBuilder* const table_;
227 };
228
229 // Define a new safepoint for the current position in the body. The
230 // `pc_offset` parameter allows to define a different offset than the current
231 // pc_offset.
232 Safepoint DefineSafepoint(Assembler* assembler, int pc_offset = 0);
233
234 // Emit the safepoint table after the body. The number of bits per
235 // entry must be enough to hold all the pointer indexes.
236 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void Emit(Assembler* assembler, int bits_per_entry);
237
238 // Find the Deoptimization Info with pc offset {pc} and update its
239 // trampoline field. Calling this function ensures that the safepoint
240 // table contains the trampoline PC {trampoline} that replaced the
241 // return PC {pc} on the stack.
242 int UpdateDeoptimizationInfo(int pc, int trampoline, int start,
243 int deopt_index);
244
245 private:
246 // Remove consecutive identical entries.
247 void RemoveDuplicates();
248
249 void UpdateMinMaxStackIndex(int index) {
250#ifdef DEBUG
251 if (index > max_stack_index_) max_stack_index_ = index;
252#endif // DEBUG
253 if (index < min_stack_index_) min_stack_index_ = index;
254 }
255
256 int min_stack_index() const {
257 return min_stack_index_ == std::numeric_limits<int>::max()
258 ? 0
259 : min_stack_index_;
260 }
261
262 // Tracks the min/max stack slot index over all entries. We need the minimum
263 // index when encoding the actual table since we shift all unused lower
264 // indices out of the encoding. Tracking the indices during safepoint
265 // construction means we don't have to iterate again later.
266#ifdef DEBUG
267 int max_stack_index_ = 0;
268#endif // DEBUG
269 int min_stack_index_ = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
270
271 ZoneDeque<EntryBuilder> entries_;
272 Zone* zone_;
273};
274
275} // namespace internal
276} // namespace v8
277
278#endif // V8_CODEGEN_SAFEPOINT_TABLE_H_
